cta.headline: Questions About Your Privacy?
cta.body: If you have any concerns about how we handle your personal information, feel free to reach out.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: At Isaac Plans we are committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, share, and safeguard your information when you use our services or visit our website.

informationCollected.title: 2. Types of Personal Information Collected
informationCollected.content: We collect the following types of personal information:
items: Personal identification: Full name, date of birth, SSN
Contact: Mailing address, email, phone numbers
Demographics: Age, gender, marital status, dependents
Financial: Income, employment details, credit history (if applicable)
Health: Medical history, pre-existing conditions (for health insurance)
Browser data: IP address, pages visited, time spent
Location data: Geographic location to determine plan eligibility
Communication logs: Calls, texts, emails
Preferences: Communication preferences, coverage interests

howWeUse.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
howWeUse.content: We use your personal information to:
items: Provide accurate insurance quotes
Process policy applications and manage coverage
Communicate about policies, renewals, and changes
Offer customer service and technical support
Meet legal and regulatory obligations
Improve our services and develop new products
Conduct market analysis and research
Prevent fraud and ensure security
Personalize your website experience
Send marketing communications (with consent)

sharingPractices.title: 4. Information Sharing Practices
sharingPractices.content: We may share your personal information under these circumstances:
items: With insurers to obtain quotes and issue policies
With service providers (payment processing, IT)
With regulators when required by law
With legal and accounting professionals
In a business transfer or sale
To protect legal rights
With your explicit consent

smsPolicy.title: 5. SMS and Phone Number Policy
smsPolicy.content: Our use of your phone number and SMS communications follows The Campaign Registry (TCR) guidelines:
items: 1 – SMS Consent Communication: phone numbers collected for SMS consent are not shared with third parties for marketing purposes.

2 – Types of SMS: payment reminders, enrollment notices, and service notifications. Examples: “Dear Client: your policy may lapse…”, or “Hi, this is a reminder of your next appointment…”. Reply STOP at any time to opt-out.
3 – Message Frequency: may vary; e.g., up to 3 SMS per week related to your policy or enrollment period.
4 – Possible Charges: standard message/data rates may apply, domestic or international.
5 – Opt-In Method: by checking the SMS-consent box in our online forms.
6 – Opt-Out Method: reply “STOP” to any SMS or contact us to be removed.
7 – Help: reply “HELP” or visit https://www.isaacplans.com/contact for assistance.
8 – Standard Disclosure: message/data rates may apply. For help text HELP to ({{PHONE_NUMBER}}). Message frequency varies.

dataSecurity.title: 6. Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We use technical, administrative, and physical safeguards to protect your information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.

yourRights.title: 7. Your Rights
items: Access the personal information we hold
Request corrections to inaccurate data
Request deletion (subject to legal obligations)
Opt-out of marketing communications
Request a copy of this privacy policy

contact.title: 8. Contact Information
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy:
details: Agent: Isaac Orraiz, Licensed in 11+ States

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Isaac Plans Insurance
metadata.description: Learn how Isaac Plans Insurance collects, uses, and protects your information. Read our privacy practices, your rights, and how to contact us.
metadata.keywords: privacy policy, data protection, personal data, cookies, security, HIPAA, contact

termsPage.title: Terms and Conditions

cta.headline: Questions About the Terms?
cta.body: If you have any questions about these terms and conditions, we're here to help.

termsPage.limitationsLabel: However, we are not responsible for:

sms.title: 1. SMS Terms and Conditions
sms.content: The following policies govern all SMS communications issued by Isaac Plans:
items: 1 – SMS Consent Communication: phone numbers collected for SMS consent are not shared with third parties for marketing purposes.

2 – Types of SMS: payment reminders, enrollment notices and service notifications. Examples: “Dear Client: we remind you that your policy is about to lapse…” or “Hi, this is a friendly reminder of your upcoming appointment…”. You may reply STOP at any time to opt out.
3 – Message Frequency: frequency may vary; for example, up to 3 SMS per week related to your policy or enrollment period.
4 – Possible Charges: standard message and data rates may apply, and may vary for domestic or international SMS.
5 – Opt-In Method: by checking the SMS-consent box in our online forms.
6 – Opt-Out Method: you may stop receiving SMS at any time by replying “STOP” or contacting us directly to be removed.
7 – Help: reply “HELP” or visit https://www.isaacplans.com/contact if you need assistance.
8 – Standard Disclosure: message/data rates may apply. For help text HELP to ({{PHONE_NUMBER}}). Message frequency varies.

introduction.title: 2. Introduction and Acceptance
introduction.content: Welcome to Isaac Plans. These Terms and Conditions (“Terms”) govern the use of our insurance services and website. By using our services, you agree to these terms.

services.title: 3. Description of Services
services.content: Isaac Plans provides the following services:
items: ACA (Obamacare) insurance consulting and advisory
Medicare insurance services (Parts A, B, C and D)
Life, dental and vision insurance
Plan comparison and analysis
Enrollment and renewal assistance
Ongoing support and customer service
Cost-optimisation and subsidy analysis

eligibility.title: 4. Eligibility and Licenses
eligibility.content: Our services are available in the states where Isaac Orraiz holds active licenses—currently 11+ U.S. states.

responsibilities.title: 5. Client Responsibilities
responsibilities.content: As a client, you agree to:
items: Provide accurate and complete information during the quote process
Notify changes that may affect your coverage
Review all policy documents carefully before signing
Pay premiums directly to the insurer as agreed
Comply with all policy terms
Maintain confidentiality of your account information

limitations.title: 6. Liability Limitations
limitations.content: Isaac Plans acts as an intermediary between you and insurance companies. Our responsibilities include:
items: Providing accurate information about available plans
Assisting with application and enrollment
Offering support during the policy term
Keeping your information confidential
limitations: Not responsible for coverage decisions by insurers
Not responsible for regulatory changes or plan availability
Liability limited to intermediation and advisory services

privacy.title: 7. Privacy and Confidentiality
privacy.content: We are committed to protecting your privacy according to our Privacy Policy:
items: Numbers collected for SMS consent are not shared with third parties for marketing
Your data is used solely to provide insurance services
We maintain strict confidentiality standards
We comply with all applicable data-protection regulations

fees.title: 8. Fees and Compensation
fees.content: Our consulting services are generally free to consumers. We are compensated by insurers, which does not affect your premium.

termination.title: 9. Service Termination
termination.content: Either party may terminate this relationship with written notice. Policies in force remain subject to their own terms.

compliance.title: 10. Legal Compliance
compliance.content: Isaac Plans operates in full compliance with:
items: State insurance regulations
Affordable Care Act (ACA)
Medicare and Medicaid regulations
Federal and state consumer-protection laws
Professional licensing requirements

modifications.title: 11. Modifications
modifications.content: We reserve the right to update these terms at any time. Changes take effect once posted on this page.

metadata.title: Terms of Service | Isaac Plans Insurance
metadata.description: Read the terms and conditions for using Isaac Plans Insurance’s website and services, including permitted use, disclaimers, limitations of liability, and contact information.
metadata.keywords: terms of service, terms and conditions, website terms, acceptable use, disclaimers, limitations of liability, indemnification, governing law, contact

definition.title: What is the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare)?
definition.description: The Affordable Care Act (ACA), also known as Obamacare, is a comprehensive health-care reform law enacted in March 2010. Its goal is to put affordable health insurance within reach of more people, expand the Medicaid program, and foster innovative methods of delivering medical care to reduce costs. Thanks to the ACA, millions of previously uninsured individuals now have access to quality health care.

about.headline: Helping You To Manage Your ACA Needs!
about.description: I am Isaac Orraiz, a licensed health-insurance agent specializing in ACA (The Affordable Care Act) plans. I help individuals and families get affordable coverage tailored to their needs, including dental, vision, hospital indemnity, cancer plans, stroke plans and more. I provide expert guidance every step of the way.
about.name: Isaac Orraiz

eligibility.intro: To be eligible to enroll in health coverage through the Health Insurance Marketplace, you must:
bullets: Live in the United States
Be a U.S. citizen or national (or be lawfully present)
Not be incarcerated
eligibility.note: There is no income limit to use the Health Insurance Marketplace. Special patient protections under the ACA ensure that insurers cannot refuse coverage based on gender or a pre-existing condition, there are no lifetime or annual limits on essential health benefits, and young adults can stay on their family's insurance plan until age 26.

enroll.intro: Enrollment in a Health Insurance Marketplace plan can be done during the annual open enrollment period or a special enrollment period triggered by life events like moving or having a baby. Here’s how to get started:
enroll.step1: Schedule a free consultation with me to identify the Marketplace options in your state.
enroll.step2: Let me complete the enrollment process and paperwork for you, step by step.
enroll.subHeading: During the enrollment period, you can:
bullets: Choose a plan for the first time
Continue with your current plan
Make changes to your current plan
Choose a new plan to replace your current one
enroll.note: Note: If you experience a life event or your household income is below a certain amount, you may qualify for a special enrollment period.

tiers.intro: The Health Insurance Marketplace offers a range of plans categorized into four metal tiers: Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum. Each tier represents a different level of cost-sharing:

plans.name: Bronze Plans
bullets: Lowest premiums
Highest out-of-pocket costs
Suitable if you want to pay lower premiums but higher costs when you need care

plans.name: Silver Plans
bullets: Moderate premiums and out-of-pocket costs
Eligible for extra savings if you qualify for cost-sharing reductions
Good balance between monthly premium and out-of-pocket costs

plans.name: Gold Plans
bullets: High premiums
Low out-of-pocket costs
Ideal if you expect to need frequent care

plans.name: Platinum Plans
bullets: Highest premiums
Lowest out-of-pocket costs
Best if you need a lot of care and can afford higher monthly premiums

options.name: Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) Plans
options.description: PPO plans offer flexibility in choosing healthcare providers. You can see any in-network provider without a referral, but out-of-network care will cost more.

options.name: Point-of-Service (POS) Plans
options.description: POS plans combine features of HMO and PPO plans. You need a referral from a primary-care physician to see specialists, but you can receive care out-of-network at higher costs.

options.name: Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) Plans
options.description: HMO plans require you to use in-network providers and get referrals from a primary-care physician. These plans typically have lower premiums and out-of-pocket costs.

options.name: Exclusive Provider Organization (EPO) Plans
options.description: EPO plans only cover in-network care except in emergencies. No referrals are needed to see specialists, making them more flexible than HMOs but without out-of-network benefits.

items.q: What Should I Budget for Health Insurance?
items.a: You should choose the Bronze or Silver plans if you need to save money, or the Gold or Platinum plans if you have a larger budget and expect to need frequent healthcare services.

items.q: Can I Work with My Preferred Doctor?
items.a: Yes, absolutely. Please ensure that your preferred doctors and hospitals are in-network to avoid high out-of-pocket costs.

items.q: Prescription Drug Needs
items.a: Choose a plan that effectively covers your medication requirements. If you are unsure which plan to choose, you can schedule a free consultation call with one of our experts below.

items.q: I Need Help Paying for Health Insurance
items.a: Premium subsidies are available for incomes between 100% and 400% of the federal poverty level; you can check your eligibility on the Health Insurance Marketplace.

items.q: How do I Sign Up?
items.a: For detailed information and personalized assistance, schedule an appointment with me today. I can guide you through the process and ensure you find a plan that fits your needs and budget.

definition.title: Why Choose Ameritas for Dental & Vision?
definition.description: Ameritas is consistently ranked among the nation’s top carriers for stand-alone dental and vision insurance. With broad provider networks, generous annual maximums, and next-day coverage on preventive services, Ameritas makes it easy to keep your smile bright and your vision clear—without breaking the bank.  I’m proud to partner with Ameritas to bring you plans that combine affordability, flexibility, and award-winning customer service.

eligibility.intro: Ameritas individual dental & vision plans are open to nearly everyone—whether you’re self-employed, retired, or simply need benefits outside an employer plan. Getting started is easy:
bullets: Be located in USA (plans available in almost every state)
Must be 18 + to purchase; cover dependents from birth
Enroll online in minutes—no health questions or waiting periods on most plans*
Pick your start date and pay the first month’s premium (rates are based on ZIP code, not age)
eligibility.note: *Day-one preventive coverage, a nationwide PPO network, optional out-of-network freedom, and zero enrollment fees make Ameritas a top choice for dental & vision protection.

enroll.intro: Ameritas lets you apply online year-round—no open-enrollment window required. Coverage can even begin as soon as tomorrow:
enroll.step1: Get an instant quote by clicking the button below and entering your Information.
enroll.step2: Check out in minutes, choose your start date, and download your e-ID card right away.
bullets: Pick any effective date up to 30 days out
Add dependents of any age (children, spouse, partner)
Select dental only, vision only, or a money-saving bundle
Pay monthly or annually with a credit/debit card or EFT
enroll.note: No enrollment fees, no health questions, and no waiting periods on preventive services. A 30-day customer satisfaction guarantee gives you extra peace of mind.

items.q: What do Ameritas dental plans cover?
items.a: Ameritas covers 100% of preventive care like cleanings and exams. Restorative procedures like fillings, crowns, or extractions are partially covered depending on the plan type.

items.q: Are there waiting periods for major services?
items.a: Some plans do not have strict waiting periods, but coverage for major services typically starts at a lower percentage in the first year (e.g., 20%) and increases to 50% or more after the first year. This allows limited access initially with greater benefits over time.

items.q: Can I continue treatment if I change plans?
items.a: Yes. Ameritas coordinates benefits across plans. If you're in active treatment and switch plans, coverage can continue up to the allowed lifetime maximum.

items.q: How much can I save with in-network providers?
items.a: Ameritas has one of the largest dental networks in the U.S. Using in-network dentists can save you between 25% and 50% compared to regular fees.

items.q: How do I access my benefits and claims?
items.a: You can view your member ID, coverage details, claims status, and more through the Ameritas website or the Ameritas Benefits mobile app.

items.q: Do vision plans include eyewear and exams?
items.a: Yes. Plans typically include one annual eye exam and a set allowance for glasses or contacts. Some plans are partnered with networks like VSP or EyeMed.

items.q: Are additional services like LASIK or hearing care available?
items.a: Yes. Ameritas offers optional benefits like LASIK discounts, hearing aid coverage, and hearing exams as part of expanded package options.

hero.description: Even with good health insurance, a hospital stay can leave you owing deductibles, coinsurance, and everyday bills. A hospital-indemnity plan pays you a lump-sum cash benefit directly, so you decide whether to cover medical costs, rent, child-care, or anything else.

testimonials.name: Maria Gonzales
testimonials.text: When my son broke his arm, the hospital bill was a shock. Our indemnity policy from Isaac sent us a check in days, and we used it to cover our deductible and groceries while I took time off work.

testimonials.name: Robert Lee
testimonials.text: I thought my regular insurance was enough. After three days in the hospital, I owed thousands. The cash benefit from my indemnity plan kept my savings intact—best decision I’ve made.

about.headline: Your trusted health-insurance partner
about.description: With licenses in multiple states and expert knowledge of supplemental plans, Isaac makes sure no gap is left unprotected.
about.name: Isaac Orraiz

definition.title: What is Hospital Indemnity Insurance?
definition.description: It’s a supplemental plan that pays YOU directly—cash per day or per event—to offset deductibles, copays and lost income while you’re hospitalized.

selfEnroll.disclaimer: Policies issued by the carrier. Subject to underwriting approval.

eligibility.intro: Hospital indemnity plans are surprisingly easy to qualify for:

bullets.3: Cash benefits paid directly to you

eligibility.note: Some pre-existing conditions may affect benefit payouts.

enroll.intro: The entire process takes about 10 minutes.

bullets.3: A few minutes of your time

0.q: Does it cover all hospital expenses?
0.a: It pays cash to you; you decide how to use it.

1.a: The carrier sends the cash benefit directly to you (check or direct deposit) usually within a few days of receiving your claim.

2.q: Is the policy portable if I change jobs or lose my major-medical coverage?
2.a: Yes. Hospital indemnity policies are individual contracts, so you can keep them as long as you pay the premiums—even if your employment or health plan changes.

3.q: Is there a waiting period before benefits begin?
3.a: Accident benefits typically start on Day 1; sickness benefits may have a 30-day waiting period, depending on the carrier.

4.q: Will this interfere with my regular health insurance?
4.a: No. Indemnity benefits are paid in addition to any other insurance you have and are not reduced by other reimbursements.

5.a: Many plans do cover them after a 6- or 12-month look-back period, but rules vary by carrier. Isaac will explain the specifics before you enroll.

6.a: Premiums depend on your age, benefit amount, and state of residence—many plans start under $1 a day.

ctaBanner.message: Ready to guard your savings? Book a free 20-minute consultation with Isaac today.

stmMetadata.title: Short Term Medical (STLDI) | Isaac Plans Insurance
stmMetadata.description: Learn about short-term medical coverage (STLDI). Temporary health insurance for gaps in coverage. Not ACA-compliant, excludes preexisting conditions, and availability varies by state.
stmMetadata.keywords: short term medical, STLDI, temporary health insurance, gap coverage, non-ACA, health plans

hero.name: Isaac Orraiz – Insurance Agent
hero.title: Bridge a gap in coverage—fast, flexible, and clearly explained
hero.description: Designed to help during short gaps—like between jobs or while waiting for other coverage to begin. This is not Minimum Essential Coverage (ACA), excludes preexisting conditions, and has important limitations that vary by state.

testimonials.name: Adriana M.
testimonials.text: Needed coverage between jobs. The process was quick and clear—exactly what I needed for a short period.

cta.label: You can apply for coverage at the following link:

definition.title: What is Short Term Medical?
definition.description: Short-Term Limited-Duration Insurance (STLDI) is temporary medical coverage meant to last months—not years. It can help with unexpected illness or injury during a gap, but it is not ACA coverage and typically doesn’t cover preexisting conditions, preventive care requirements, or certain benefits such as maternity or mental health. Always review details in the quote flow and policy documents for your state.

body.part1: For policies sold or issued on or after Sept 1, 2024, federal rules limit STLDI to an initial term of
body.part3: including any renewals or extensions. State rules and carrier filings vary; review the quote details before applying.

about.headline: Your trusted advisor for gap coverage
about.description: I help you understand when short-term coverage may make sense and when an ACA plan or other option may be a better fit.
about.name: Isaac Orraiz

eligibility.intro: Eligibility and terms vary by state and underwriting. Generally, STM is designed for:
bullets: People between jobs or waiting for other coverage to start
Healthy applicants who don’t need ongoing care for preexisting conditions
Individuals who want fast effective dates (where available)
Those comfortable with benefit limits and potential exclusions
eligibility.note: Short term medical is not a substitute for comprehensive ACA coverage. Read all notices and policy terms carefully.

enroll.intro: Applying typically takes a few minutes.
steps: Use the official quoting button to see plans and pricing for your state.
Review disclosures and submit your application online.
bullets: Basic personal information
Your home address and contact details
Preferred start date (subject to state rules and availability)
A payment method
enroll.note: Availability, waiting periods, and effective dates vary by state.

items.q: Is Short Term Medical ACA-compliant?
items.a: No. STM is not Minimum Essential Coverage and does not include ACA protections or essential health benefits.

items.q: Are preexisting conditions covered?
items.a: Typically no. STM usually excludes preexisting conditions and may include other limitations. Read the specific policy documents.

items.q: How long can it last?
items.a: Federal rules limit STM sold on or after Sept 1, 2024 to an initial term of up to 3 months and a maximum total duration of 4 months including renewals. States may have additional limits.

items.q: Can I keep my current doctor?
items.a: Provider access and discounts vary by plan and state. Review network and reimbursement information in the quote flow.

items.q: Does it include benefits like maternity or mental health?
items.a: Often limited or excluded. Check the quote flow and policy for details.

items.q: Can I cancel early?
items.a: Cancellation and refund rules vary by state and policy. Review the disclosures shown during the online application.

items.q: What happens when it ends?
items.a: STM is meant for short gaps. Before it ends, consider enrolling in an ACA plan, employer coverage, or another qualifying option.

ctaBanner.message: Not sure if short-term is right for you? Get quick, unbiased guidance.

underwriter.label: Underwriter:
underwriter.text: Most UnitedHealthOne® plans are underwritten by Golden Rule Insurance Company (a UnitedHealthcare company). Product availability varies by state and form; not available in all states.

notMEC.label: Not Minimum Essential Coverage:
notMEC.text: Short Term Medical is not ACA coverage and may have limits, exclusions, and waiting periods. Preexisting conditions are typically not covered.

linkUse.label: Quoting link use:
linkUse.text: Residents of South Carolina cannot use the E-Store link. Use of the E-Store link is subject to carrier terms.

disclosures.footer: This page is for general information only. Always review the notices and policy/certificate for your state before applying.

hero.name: Isaac Orraiz – Insurance Agent
hero.title: Flexible Protection with Growth Potential
hero.description: IUL is permanent life insurance with flexible premiums and an adjustable death benefit. Cash value can earn interest linked to a market index (not invested directly), subject to caps, participation rates, and policy charges.

testimonials.name: Angela M.
testimonials.text: Isaac explained IUL in plain English and built an illustration around my goals. I love the flexibility as my income changes.

testimonials.name: Derrick S.
testimonials.text: We wanted lifetime coverage plus a way to build policy value. The custom IUL design gave us both—without market downside in the index crediting.

about.headline: Tailored life-insurance strategies—built around your goals
about.description: I help families design IUL policies with the right blend of protection and flexibility. We’ll review funding strategies, riders, and how loans/withdrawals can impact your coverage and long-term goals.
about.name: Isaac Orraiz

definition.title: What is Indexed Universal Life?
definition.description: IUL is a type of universal life policy that credits interest to cash value based on an index (e.g., S&P 500®) using a policy’s crediting method. It typically includes a floor (e.g., 0%) that limits downside to the credited interest, and may include caps and participation rates that limit upside. Policy charges and the cost of insurance apply.

eligibility.intro: IUL can fit people who want permanent coverage and cash-value flexibility:
bullets: Need lifetime death-benefit protection
Want potential, tax-advantaged cash-value accumulation
Prefer flexible premiums and adjustable benefits
Are comfortable with index caps/participation limits and policy charges
eligibility.note: Loans and withdrawals reduce cash value and death benefit and may cause a policy to lapse. Tax treatment can vary—consult a tax professional.

enroll.intro: We’ll build an illustration around your budget and goals:

steps.0: Identify coverage needs, riders, and time horizon
steps.1: Choose funding strategy and index crediting options

bullets: Coverage amount and funding levels
Cap, floor, and participation rate mechanics
Riders (e.g., accelerated benefits) and policy charges
Loan/withdrawal strategies and risks
enroll.note: Illustrations are hypothetical and not guarantees of future performance.

items.q: Is my money invested in the stock market?
items.a: No. Indexes are used as a benchmark for crediting interest. Cash value is not directly invested in the market.

items.q: What are caps, floors, and participation rates?
items.a: They are policy settings that limit upside (cap), set a minimum credited rate (floor, often 0%), and determine how much of the index change is credited (participation rate).

items.q: Can my premiums change?
items.a: Yes. Universal life allows flexible premiums, but underfunding can reduce cash value and may lead to policy lapse if charges exceed value.

items.q: What happens if I take a loan or withdrawal?
items.a: Loans/withdrawals reduce cash value and death benefit and may create tax consequences if the policy lapses or is a MEC. Ask your tax advisor.

items.q: Are returns guaranteed?
items.a: No. Credited interest is based on the policy’s crediting method and index performance, subject to caps/participation. Many policies include a 0% floor for the credited rate, but charges still apply.

items.q: Who might consider IUL?
items.a: People seeking permanent coverage, flexible funding, and potential cash-value growth for long-term goals like protection, supplemental income strategies, or legacy planning.

ctaBanner.message: Ready to see a personalized IUL illustration? Book a 20-minute call.

iulMetadata.description: Permanent protection with flexible premiums and index-linked cash value. Learn how caps, floors, charges, and loans work—and get a tailored illustration.
iulMetadata.keywords: indexed universal life, IUL, permanent life insurance, cash value, life insurance illustration, flexible premiums

hero.name: Isaac Orraiz – Insurance Agent
hero.title: Simple, Guaranteed Coverage for Life’s Final Costs
hero.description: Final expense insurance (whole life) is designed to help loved ones pay for funeral, burial/cremation, medical bills, and small debts. Level premiums, fixed benefits, and fast, paper-light applications.

testimonials.name: Evelyn Carter
testimonials.text: We wanted something affordable that wouldn’t expire at 80. Isaac found a plan that fits our budget with day-one coverage. Huge relief.

testimonials.name: Miguel Alvarez
testimonials.text: The process took minutes. Isaac explained graded vs. immediate benefits clearly and we chose what made sense for our health.

about.headline: Your trusted guide for simple, permanent protection
about.description: I help you compare final expense carriers, build a realistic benefit amount, and apply online—often with instant decisions.
about.name: Isaac Orraiz

definition.title: What Is Final Expense Insurance?
definition.description: A small whole-life policy (typically $5,000–$40,000) that never expires as long as premiums are paid. Benefits can be used for funeral costs, cremation/burial, medical bills, or any need.

selfEnroll.disclaimer: Policies issued by the carrier. Subject to underwriting.

generic.title: Prefer to start online?
generic.subtitle: Request a quick quote and we’ll match carriers to your health profile.

eligibility.intro: Options exist for a wide range of health histories:
bullets: Issue ages commonly 45–85 (varies by carrier)
Immediate or graded benefits depending on health
No medical exam—simple health questions
Fixed premiums and lifetime coverage
eligibility.note: Approved benefit amounts and waiting periods vary by carrier and health history.

steps.0: Answer a few health questions to determine level vs. graded benefits
steps.1: Choose a benefit amount that fits your budget

bullets: Basic personal information and beneficiary
Health history (yes/no questions)
Preferred payment method (bank or card)
A few minutes of your time

0.q: Is this term or whole life?
0.a: Final expense is usually whole life—premiums and coverage are designed to remain level for life.

1.q: What’s the difference between level and graded benefits?
1.a: Level benefit pays full coverage day one for eligible applicants; graded may pay a reduced amount for natural causes during the first 24 months, then full thereafter.

2.q: Do I need a medical exam?
2.a: Typically no exam—just health questions and database checks.

3.q: Can I choose any funeral home?
3.a: Yes. The beneficiary receives the tax-free death benefit and can pay any provider.

4.a: Whole-life final expense policies are designed with level premiums that do not increase with age.

5.q: How much coverage should I buy?
5.a: Many families choose $10,000–$20,000 to cover funeral/cremation and small debts. We’ll tailor it to your needs.

6.a: Carriers often pay approved claims within days of receiving required documents.

ctaBanner.message: Want a quick quote matched to your health and budget? Book a free 15-minute call.

feMetadata.title: Final Expense (Burial) Insurance | Isaac Plans Insurance
feMetadata.description: Affordable, permanent coverage to help with funeral and final bills. Compare level vs. graded benefits with bilingual agent Isaac Orraiz.
feMetadata.imageAlt: Preview card: Final Expense insurance by Isaac Plans Insurance
feMetadata.keywords: final expense insurance, burial insurance, whole life, level benefit, graded benefit, small whole life policy
